alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 20 at 10:44PM MST until January 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches with locally higher amounts near the Colorado border. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass and Union County. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel will be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-25. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant impacts have occurred along I-25 near Raton Pass as well as portions of U.S. Highway 64/87 from Raton to Clayton.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
